layer_get_y: You can use this function to retrieve the y position of the layer within the currently scoped room. You supply the layer ID (which you get when you create the layer using layer_create()) or the layer name (as a string - this will have a performance impact) and the function returns a real number for the x position of the layer, relative to the (0,0) position of the room. Default is 0.
